channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Court orders a new hearing for Adnan Syed in 'Serial' case. Here's what to know
item.description: The Maryland Supreme Court upheld a decision to reinstate Syed's murder conviction and ordered a redo hearing. It comes just two years since Syed was freed from prison.
item.content:encoded:
The Maryland Supreme Court upheld a decision to reinstate Syed's murder conviction and ordered a redo hearing. It comes just two years since Syed was freed from prison.

(Image credit: Susan Walsh)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: The U.S. national security adviser meets with Chinese leaders in Beijing
item.description: National security adviser Jake Sullivan wrapped up a trip to Beijing by meeting with China's leader, Xi Jinping.
item.content:encoded: National security adviser Jake Sullivan wrapped up a trip to Beijing by meeting with China's leader, Xi Jinping.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Vice President Kamala Harris answered questions on CNN about her policy views
item.description: It was Harris' first major interview as the Democratic presidential nominee. She said she’d appoint a Republican to her Cabinet if elected, and she responded to questions about policy shifts over the years.
item.content:encoded: It was Harris' first major interview as the Democratic presidential nominee. She said she’d appoint a Republican to her Cabinet if elected, and she responded to questions about policy shifts over the years.
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: A Brazilian Supreme Court judge blocks X in Brazil, in a dispute with Elon Musk
item.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has ordered the suspension of Elon Musk's social media giant X in Brazil after the tech billionaire refused to name a legal representative in the country.
item.content:encoded:
A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has ordered the suspension of Elon Musk's social media giant X in Brazil after the tech billionaire refused to name a legal representative in the country.

(Image credit: Eraldo Peres)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A bill to protect performers from unauthorized AI heads to California governor
item.description: California Assembly Bill 2602 would regulate the use of generative AI for performers – not only those on-screen in films, TV and streaming series but also audiobooks and video games.
item.content:encoded:
California Assembly Bill 2602 would regulate the use of generative AI for performers – not only those on-screen in films, TV and streaming series but also audiobooks and video games.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: The Pain and Frustration of Families of Israeli Hostages Held in Gaza
item.description:
As the war drags on, families of hostages who have been held in Gaza for nearly eleven months are becoming increasingly frustrated and angry. Some of them release some of their pain by yelling their loved ones names into Gaza, in hopes of being heard.

And the U.S. pressures Israel to change the way it evacuates civilians from parts of Gaza, amid fears of their safety.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.content:encoded:
As the war drags on, families of hostages who have been held in Gaza for nearly eleven months are becoming increasingly frustrated and angry. Some of them release some of their pain by yelling their loved ones names into Gaza, in hopes of being heard.

And the U.S. pressures Israel to change the way it evacuates civilians from parts of Gaza, amid fears of their safety.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Donor's note trashing design of pillars he funded at London's National Gallery is found
item.description: Lord Sainsbury didn’t like the design of the wing his family funded. He paid for it though, and slipped a 1990 letter into a pillar during construction. Construction workers found it 33 years later.
item.content:encoded:
Lord Sainsbury didn’t like the design of the wing his family funded. He paid for it though, and slipped a 1990 letter into a pillar during construction. Construction workers found it 33 years later.

(Image credit: In Pictures Ltd.)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: Trump says he'll support free IVF treatments in a second term
item.description: Former President Donald Trump told crowds in Wisconsin and Michigan that he would make IVF treatment free if he wins a second term. “I was always for IVF," Trump told them.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump told crowds in Wisconsin and Michigan that he would make IVF treatment free if he wins a second term. “I was always for IVF," Trump told them.

(Image credit: Kamil Krzaczynski)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Two of tennis' biggest names are knocked out of the U.S. Open in the 2nd round
item.description: The final Grand Slam of the year isn't lacking in drama. Third-ranked Carlos Alcaraz lost to no. 74 Botic van de Zandschulp in a stunning upset, while Naomi Osaka's comeback hopes were dashed.
item.content:encoded:
The final Grand Slam of the year isn't lacking in drama. Third-ranked Carlos Alcaraz lost to no. 74 Botic van de Zandschulp in a stunning upset, while Naomi Osaka's comeback hopes were dashed.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau and Luke Hales)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: An American researcher drowns after a Viking replica ship sinks off Norway's coast
item.description: A Viking replica ship capsized several days into its journey from the Faroe Islands to Norway. Five crew members survived, but researcher Karla Dana, 29, drowned. She was the lone American on board.
item.content:encoded: A Viking replica ship capsized several days into its journey from the Faroe Islands to Norway. Five crew members survived, but researcher Karla Dana, 29, drowned. She was the lone American on board.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
